message: Welcome to our store! I'm excited to offer you a high-quality product today. Given its exceptional value and the high satisfaction rate of our previous customers with similar items, I'm confident it will meet and exceed your expectations. Considering its worth of $40000 to you, the fixed price of $10000 seems like an incredible deal. Don't miss out on this opportunity to own a premium product at a fraction of its true value.
I'd like to pass on this one. I'd like to see some sales data before making a purchase.

However, I'd like to know the probability of it being low-quality, which is 1 - 0.8 = 0.2 or 20%. Can you confirm these probabilities, and I'll make my decision accordingly?
